ground_truth: Nema drives the truck through his village which sits beneath the mountains. Nema's grandma feeds chickens in a pen. Nema pulls up outside his grandma's house. Nema's grandma steadies a chicken and chops its head off. It is a winter hat. Yuri sits apart staring at a photograph of his ex-wife and the twins. Jackson joins him and hands him a flight jacket. Yuri glances at the women, and Jackson nods and raises his eyebrows. Gordon peers down the cockpit, descends steps in the Antonov, points his thumb upstairs, and climbs back up. Jackson and Yuri join him and Sasha in the cockpit. Through smoke and clouds, they see fire and mountain lava; Hawaii is devastated. The Antonov flies over the city as skyscrapers collapse and burn. On Air Force One, he enters the Presidential cabin, and she looks away from him. Nora smiles and nods. At night, a phone rings on the desk. A child opens a bedroom door, and a girl in slippers trots across floorboards. The child picks up the receiver; Tony is calling from the ship with a hand over one ear. Her father and mother sit up in bed as the daughter runs into their room. Husband and wife exchange glances. Tony studies her photograph and fights back tears. His son picks up the receiver and studies it, then looks back across the room where his Japanese wife stands with her arms on the child's shoulders. The room begins to shake. Tony hears the screams before the line goes dead. He hangs up and glances away. In Washington, President Wilson walks through crowds outside the White House as ash falls like snow. The injured are being treated beside ambulances. Wilson enters the West Wing; his clothes are covered in ash, and people stare at him. A fireman touches the brim of his hat, and a female paramedic jumps to her feet to salute him. He acknowledges her salute, then crosses to a woman with a small girl. Behind the woman is a couch; his secretary runs over. Outside, the ash continues to fall as crowds mill around. The medic looks up, and everyone looks around. The ground now violently shakes. Patients are being treated on gurneys that are alarmed. It splits open. The president, clinging to a drip stand, fixes his eyes on the tall pointed Washington monument. It sways and starts to fall like a felled tree. On Air Force One, all eyes turn to Laura. Adrian watches Anheuser. At Saint Peter's in Rome, the Pope leads the prayers of the faithful gathered in the square. The Cardinals gathered inside look up at the great painted ceiling of the Sistine Chapel as it begins to crack; great cracks appear in the walls, and the ceiling gives way.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Nema drives through his mountain village where his grandma feeds chickens before beheading one. Yuri, examining a photo of his ex-wife and twins, receives a flight jacket from Jackson. Gordon descends the Antonov's steps, signals, and goes back up as Jackson and Yuri join him. Through smoke, they see Hawaii's destruction. The Antonov flies over collapsing skyscrapers. On Air Force One, he enters the Presidential cabin where she looks away. Nora smiles; at night, a child answers the phone as Tony calls from the ship. The daughter's parents rise as she enters. Tony holds back tears while his son listens; screams interrupt, and the line dies. In Washington, President Wilson, covered in ash, moves through White House crowds. He acknowledges a paramedic's salute, then approaches a woman and child. As the ground shakes, the Washington Monument sways and falls. On Air Force One, Laura is watched. At Saint Peter's, the Pope prays as the Sistine Chapel's ceiling cracks and collapses.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Nema skillfully maneuvers the large truck along the dusty roads of his quaint village, which cozily nestles at the foothills of majestic mountains. As he navigates the familiar path, Nema's grandmother is busy tending to her flock, feeding the lively chickens confined within a sturdy pen. Bringing the vehicle to a halt just outside her modest house, Nema watches as his grandmother expertly steadies one of the flapping chickens and swiftly decapitates it with precision. Meanwhile, a winter hat provides warmth against the cold.

Elsewhere, Yuri is sitting apart from the others, deeply lost in thought as he gazes at a photograph that captures the image of his ex-wife along with their twins. Jackson approaches Yuri, joining him as he holds out a sturdy flight jacket. Yuri takes a moment, glancing over at the women, while Jackson acknowledges with a nod and a raise of his eyebrows. In the cockpit, Gordon peers down from his position, descends the steps of the mighty Antonov, gestures with his thumb toward the upper deck, and then climbs back up. Jackson, Yuri, and Sasha soon join him in the bustling cockpit. Through the haze of smoke and clouds, they witness scenes of destruction as fire and molten lava from the mountain ravage Hawaii. The Antonov flies over the devastated city where towering skyscrapers crumble and burn in the chaos.

On Air Force One, entering the Presidential cabin, he finds her looking away, avoiding his gaze. Nora, however, offers a smile and a nod of acknowledgment. As night falls, the sound of a phone ringing echoes on the desk. A child opens a bedroom door, and a girl in soft slippers walks briskly across creaky floorboards. As the child lifts the receiver, Tony is on the other end, calling from the ship with one hand tightly pressed over his ear to block out the noise. The child's parents sit up abruptly in bed as their daughter rushes into their room. Exchanging concerned glances, the husband and wife silently communicate their shared worry. Tony, fighting back tears, studies a cherished photograph. His son then picks up the receiver, examining it thoughtfully before looking across the room where his Japanese wife stands, her hands gently resting on their child's shoulders. Abruptly, the room starts to tremble. Before the line goes dead, Tony hears the chilling sound of screams, forcing him to hang up and turn his gaze away, overwhelmed by emotion.

In Washington, President Wilson strides purposefully through the masses outside the iconic White House, where ash descends from the sky like eerie snowflakes. The injured lie on the ground, receiving urgent care next to ambulances. Entering the West Wing, Wilson's clothes are dusted with ash, drawing the attention of onlookers. A fireman respectfully touches the brim of his hat, while a female paramedic quickly stands to salute him. Acknowledging her salute, he moves toward a woman holding a small girl, with a couch positioned just behind her. His secretary rushes over to him amidst the commotion. Outside, the ash continues to fall relentlessly as crowds move about in a state of agitation. The medic lifts her gaze, while everyone around feels the earth beneath them begin to shake violently. Patients being treated on gurneys show expressions of alarm as the ground dramatically splits open. The president, desperately clinging to a drip stand for support, focuses intently on the tall, iconic Washington monument. As it sways ominously, it starts to topple, resembling a grand tree being felled.

Back on Air Force One, all eyes instinctively turn towards Laura, anticipation thick in the air. Adrian observes Anheuser intently, gauging his reaction. In a different corner of the world, at Saint Peter's in Rome, the Pope solemnly leads the prayers of the faithful gathered in the open square. Inside, the Cardinals collectively look upward, their eyes fixed on the magnificent painted ceiling of the Sistine Chapel, as cracks form and spread across the surface. The walls and the ceiling, unable to withstand the pressure, begin to crumble and cave in.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Nema skillfully maneuvers the large, imposing truck along the dusty, winding roads of his quaint, picturesque village, which is cozily nestled at the foothills of majestic, towering mountains. As he navigates the familiar, well-worn path, Nema's grandmother is busy tending to her flock of animals, diligently feeding the lively, clucking chickens that are confined within a sturdy, well-constructed pen. Bringing the vehicle to a halt just outside her modest, humble house, Nema watches attentively as his grandmother, with expert precision, steadies one of the flapping chickens and swiftly decapitates it with remarkable accuracy. Meanwhile, a thick winter hat provides much-needed warmth against the penetrating cold.

Elsewhere, in a quieter spot away from the gathering, Yuri is sitting apart from the others, deeply lost in thought as he gazes down at a cherished photograph that captures the image of his ex-wife along with their adorable twins. Jackson approaches Yuri, joining him in silent companionship as he holds out a sturdy, well-worn flight jacket. Yuri takes a moment to glance over at the women, while Jackson acknowledges this shared moment with a nod and a raise of his eyebrows. In the cockpit of the mighty aircraft, Gordon peers down from his elevated position, descends the steps of the colossal Antonov, gestures with his thumb toward the upper deck, and then climbs back up with determination. Jackson, Yuri, and Sasha soon join him in the bustling, cramped cockpit. Through the haze of smoke and gathering clouds, they witness shocking scenes of destruction as fire and molten lava from the furious mountain ravage the beautiful landscape of Hawaii. The powerful Antonov flies over the devastated city where once-towering skyscrapers now crumble and burn amidst the chaos.

On Air Force One, as he enters the stately Presidential cabin, he finds her gazing away, avoiding his direct gaze. Nora, however, offers a polite smile and a nod of acknowledgment. As the night falls, the unmistakable sound of a phone ringing echoes loudly on the desk. A child opens a bedroom door, and a young girl in soft, fuzzy slippers walks briskly across creaky floorboards. As the child lifts the receiver, Tony is on the other end, calling anxiously from the ship with one hand tightly pressed over his ear to block out the overwhelming noise. The child's parents sit up abruptly in bed as their daughter rushes into their room. Exchanging concerned glances, the husband and wife silently communicate their shared worry and fear. Tony, fighting back tears, studies a cherished, beloved photograph. His son then picks up the receiver, examining it thoughtfully before looking across the room where his Japanese wife stands, her gentle hands resting reassuringly on their child's shoulders. Abruptly, the room begins to tremble violently. Before the line goes dead, Tony hears the chilling, heart-wrenching sound of screams, forcing him to hang up the phone and turn his gaze away, overwhelmed by emotion and grief.

In Washington, President Wilson strides purposefully through the dense masses gathered outside the iconic White House, where ash descends ominously from the sky like eerie, ghostly snowflakes. The injured lie on the ground, receiving urgent medical care next to the waiting ambulances. Entering the West Wing, Wilson's clothes are dusted with a fine layer of ash, drawing the focused attention of onlookers. A fireman respectfully touches the brim of his helmet, while a female paramedic quickly stands to salute him. Acknowledging her salute with a nod, he moves toward a woman holding a small girl, with a couch positioned just behind her. His secretary rushes over to him amidst the chaotic commotion. Outside, the relentless ash continues to fall, covering everything, as crowds move about in a state of intense agitation. The medic lifts her gaze, while everyone around feels the earth beneath them begin to shake violently and uncontrollably. Patients being treated on gurneys show expressions of alarm and terror as the ground dramatically splits open beneath them. The president, desperately clinging to a drip stand for support, focuses intently on the tall, iconic Washington monument. As it sways ominously, like a majestic tree caught in a storm, it starts to topple, resembling a grand tree being felled.

Back on Air Force One, all eyes instinctively turn towards Laura, with anticipation thick and palpable in the air. Adrian observes Anheuser intently, carefully gauging his reaction. In a different corner of the world, at the historic Saint Peter's in Rome, the Pope solemnly leads the prayers of the faithful, who are gathered in the vast open square. Inside, the Cardinals collectively look upward, their eyes fixed on the magnificent, intricately painted ceiling of the Sistine Chapel, as cracks start to form and spread ominously across the ornate surface. The walls and the ceiling, unable to withstand the mounting pressure, begin to crumble and cave in.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Nema sits behind the wheel of the truck, navigating it carefully through the narrow, winding roads that weave through his small village nestled beneath towering mountains. As he maneuvers the truck, his eyes take in the familiar sights of his hometown, where small houses and fields line his path. Gradually, he approaches his destination, pulling up outside his grandma's house with precision. Nearby, his grandma stands in a pen, surrounded by clucking chickens, methodically scattering feed from her hands. She then singles out one chicken, ensuring her grip is firm and steady before swiftly and decisively chopping off its head, the action a stark juxtaposition to the winter hat she wears. In another setting, Yuri sits apart from others, his focus entirely on a photograph he's holdingâ€”a picture of his ex-wife and their twins. As he stares, lost in thought, Jackson approaches and silently sits down beside him, extending a flight jacket toward Yuri as a gesture of solidarity. Yuri's eyes shift from the photograph to the women in their vicinity, and Jackson communicates silently with him through a nod and a subtle raise of his eyebrows, indicating understanding. Meanwhile, Gordon peers down from the cockpit of the Antonov, assessing the situation below before descending the steps methodically. Upon reaching the bottom, he points his thumb upward, signaling to those above before turning around and climbing back up the steps into the cockpit. Jackson and Yuri make their way to join Gordon and Sasha in the confined space. Together, they peer through the smoke-filled clouds, their eyes widening as they witness the devastation belowâ€”raging fires and molten lava spilling from the mountains, consuming Hawaii. The Antonov continues its path over the city, where skyscrapers crumble and blaze, a landscape of destruction sprawling beneath them. Thousands of miles away on Air Force One, a man enters the Presidential cabin, where a woman deliberately averts her gaze from him, the tension palpable. Nora, observing the interaction, offers a supportive smile and a nod of encouragement. The quiet of night is broken by the shrill ring of a phone on a desk, echoing through the house. Responding to the sound, a child opens a bedroom door with care, and a girl in slippers, her footsteps light on the floorboards, crosses the room purposefully. She picks up the receiver to hear Tony's voice, calling from the ship, his other hand cupped over one ear to block out the noise. In their bedroom, the child's father and mother sit up abruptly, roused by their daughter's urgent entry. They exchange glances, their concern mirrored in each other's eyes. Aboard the ship, Tony gazes at a photograph, emotions welling up as he struggles to hold back tears. His son, standing beside him, picks up the phone receiver, examining it curiously before turning his gaze toward his Japanese wife, who stands nearby with her hands resting gently on the child's shoulders. Suddenly, the room begins to shake violently, an ominous tremor that Tony feels through the phone line, which goes dead after a cacophony of screams. He hangs up slowly, his eyes shifting away to process the moment. In Washington, President Wilson walks with purpose through dense crowds gathered outside the White House amidst the surreal scene of ash descending like snow. Hurriedly, paramedics attend to the injured beside ambulances parked haphazardly, while the President, clothes dusted with ash, strides purposefully into the West Wing, where the stares of those around him follow his movement. A fireman respectfully touches the brim of his hat, and a female paramedic springs to her feet, saluting the President as he acknowledges her salute. Continuing on, he approaches a woman standing with a small girl, aware of the couch positioned behind them. His secretary rushes to his side, ready to assist. Outside, the ash continues to fall steadily as the crowd remains abuzz with activity. The ground suddenly erupts in violent tremors, panicking onlookers, and throwing the patients on gurneys into disarray. The earth beneath them splits open, an alarming fissure forming. In the midst of this chaos, the President, clutching tightly to a drip stand for support, fixes his gaze on the Washington Monument, its tall, pointed structure swaying ominously before it starts to topple like a massive tree being felled. Meanwhile, on Air Force One, all attention shifts to Laura, whose presence draws the eyes of everyone onboard. Adrian remains focused on Anheuser, observing his every move. In Rome, at Saint Peter's, the Pope stands at the forefront, leading a congregation in prayer within the vast square. Inside, cardinals gather beneath the iconic painted ceiling of the Sistine Chapel, which begins to fractureâ€”a series of deep cracks appearing across its surface and spreading down the walls, heralding the inevitable collapse of the majestic ceiling.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Nema drives his truck through the village under the mountains and arrives outside his grandmaâ€™s house, where she is feeding chickens. She quickly and efficiently dispatches one for a meal. Meanwhile, Yuri sits alone, staring at a photograph of his ex-wife and twins, until Jackson joins him, handing him a flight jacket and exchanging a knowing nod. Gordon descends from the Antonov, gestures for them to join, and they all head to the cockpit with Sasha. They witness the devastation of Hawaii through smoke and lava as the Antonov flies over collapsing skyscrapers.

Later, on Air Force One, he enters the Presidential cabin, where the atmosphere is tense, but Nora offers a supportive smile. That night, a phone rings; a child answers and informs her parents that Tony is calling from the ship. As the room shakes, Tony, holding back tears, hears screams before the line goes dead. In Washington, President Wilson navigates through ash-covered crowds outside the White House, acknowledging greetings from emergency responders, and joins a woman with her child. As the ash falls, the ground shakes violently, splitting open, and the President watches the Washington Monument sway and fall. On Air Force One, attention shifts to Laura as Adrian observes Anheuser. In Rome, the Pope leads prayers at Saint Peter's while the Cardinals witness the Sistine Chapel's ceiling crack and give way.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Nema drives the truck through his village, a small community known for its traditional wooden houses, which sits beneath the towering Himalayas, renowned for their majestic snow-capped peaks. Nema's grandma, who is known as the village's best poultry keeper, feeds chickens in a pen crafted from local timber. Nema pulls up outside his grandma's house, a modest dwelling that has sheltered generations of his family. Nema's grandma, with practiced hands, steadies a chicken and chops its head off, a skill passed down through generations, as customary for preparing meals in the village. It is a winter hat, distinct with its hand-knitted pattern resembling traditional Himalayan designs. Yuri sits apart, deep in thought, staring at a photograph of his ex-wife and the twins, captured during their last vacation together on the sunny beaches of Mallorca. Jackson joins him and hands him a flight jacket, a relic from their time in the Air Force during overseas missions. Yuri glances at the women in a way that reveals the depth of his longing, and Jackson nods and raises his eyebrows, a silent gesture of understanding forged through years of friendship. Gordon, a seasoned pilot known for his expertise in navigating turbulent skies, peers down the cockpit, descends steps in the Antonov, a massive aircraft used for transporting heavy cargo, points his thumb upstairs, and climbs back up. Jackson and Yuri join him and Sasha in the cockpit, their makeshift sanctuary amid chaos. Through smoke and clouds, they see fire and mountain lava; Hawaii is devastated, the result of an unprecedented volcanic eruption. The Antonov flies over the city as skyscrapers collapse and burn, a scene reminiscent of apocalyptic visions. On Air Force One, he enters the Presidential cabin, the nerve center of decision-making in times of crisis, and she looks away from him, her expression unreadable. Nora smiles and nods, offering a silent gesture of support. At night, a phone rings on the desk in the study of a suburban home. A child, curious and cautious, opens a bedroom door, and a girl in slippers trots across floorboards, worn smooth by years of use. The child picks up the receiver; Tony is calling from the ship, stationed off the coast, with a hand over one ear to block the noise of crashing waves. Her father and mother sit up in bed as the daughter runs into their room, her slippers pattering against the hardwood. Husband and wife exchange glances, a conversation of fears and hopes passing silently between them. Tony studies her photograph, a cherished keepsake, and fights back tears. His son picks up the receiver and studies it, then looks back across the room where his Japanese wife stands with her arms on the child's shoulders, offering comfort amidst uncertainty. The room begins to shake, a foreboding sign of the seismic activity spreading worldwide. Tony hears the screams before the line goes dead, a chilling reminder of the fragility of human connection. He hangs up and glances away, grappling with the magnitude of the situation. In Washington, President Wilson walks through crowds outside the White House, his leadership tested as ash falls like snow from the disrupted atmosphere. The injured, victims of the widespread chaos, are being treated beside ambulances. Wilson enters the West Wing; his clothes are covered in ash, and people stare at him, symbolizing the gravity of the crisis. A fireman, his uniform marked by soot from battling blazes, touches the brim of his hat, and a female paramedic jumps to her feet to salute him, a moment of solemn respect amidst the chaos. He acknowledges her salute, then crosses to a woman with a small girl, seeking to reassure the vulnerable amid the disaster. Behind the woman is a couch; his secretary, a steadfast presence in the administration, runs over. Outside, the ash continues to fall as crowds mill around, a scene of confusion and fear. The medic looks up, and everyone looks around as the ground now violently shakes, a relentless reminder of natureâ€™s power. Patients are being treated on gurneys that are alarmed, their wheels straining against the shifting earth. It splits open in a terrifying display of geological force. The president, clinging to a drip stand, fixes his eyes on the tall pointed Washington monument, an iconic symbol of American resilience. It sways and starts to fall like a felled tree, an unthinkable event in the heart of the nation. On Air Force One, all eyes turn to Laura, whose calm demeanor is both reassuring and authoritative. Adrian watches Anheuser, the defense secretary, as they brace for what comes next. At Saint Peter's in Rome, the Pope leads the prayers of the faithful gathered in the square, seeking divine intervention as the world seems to crumble. The Cardinals gathered inside look up at the great painted ceiling of the Sistine Chapel, a masterpiece of Renaissance art, as it begins to crack; great cracks appear in the walls, and the ceiling gives way, a haunting symbol of the shared human plight.

A farmer dusts the rim of his coat, and a male astronaut sits on her knee to applaud him. He returns her applause, then walks to a man with a tiny squirrel. Beside the man is a bike; his friend bounces over. Inside, the glitter continues to swirl as animals meander about. The chef gazes up, and nobody looks down. The world now gently quivers. Giants are being entertained on bicycles that are energized. It heals completely. The emperor, swinging from a rope ladder, turns his gaze on the short flat London mound. It dances and ceases to tremble like a flowing stream. On Bluebird Two, every mind pivots to Brian. Serena watches Ferguson. At Saint John's in Paris, the Rabbi follows the meditations of the loyal gathered in the arena. The Bishops assembled outside stare at the great sprawling floor of the Louvre Gallery as it starts to split; tiny bumps form in the floors, and the floor holds steady.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Nema drives through his village beneath the mountains, stopping at his grandma's house where she feeds chickens. Meanwhile, Yuri, reflecting on his past, is given a flight jacket by Jackson. They join Gordon and Sasha in the Antonov cockpit, witnessing Hawaii's destruction by volcanic activity. As skyscrapers collapse below, President Wilson, covered in ash, moves through crowds in Washington, acknowledging a paramedic's salute. Suddenly, the ground shakes, splitting open, as the Washington Monument sways and falls. On Air Force One, attention shifts to Laura and Adrian. In Rome, the Pope prays as the Sistine Chapel's ceiling cracks and collapses.
